intro: Vilfa hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's vilfa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, oblong fruits. Vilfa hookeri is often found in high-altitude regions and is adapted to arid conditions.
